com.jessieamorris.httpserver.server

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jessieamorris.httpserver.server.HttpResponse

  • public class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the HttpResponse. This is used to set the headers and body of a response to a given request.
    See Also:
    HttpRequest

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpResponse(java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
      Constructor for the HttpResponse object.

    • Method Summary

      Sends an error to the client.

      Sets the HTTP body to be sent in the response

      Sets the HTTP body to be sent by using the output from a BufferedReader

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpResponse

        public HttpResponse(java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
        Constructor for the HttpResponse object. The Date and Content-Type headers are automatically set. Date is set to the current date and Content-Type defaults to text/html.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - the stream to output the HttpResponse once it is finished
        See Also:
        OutputStream

    • Method Detail

      • setBody

        public void setBody(java.lang.String body)
        Sets the HTTP body to be sent in the response
        Parameters:
        body - a string containing the HTTP response body.

      • setBodyReader

        public void setBodyReader(java.io.BufferedReader bodyReader)
        Sets the HTTP body to be sent by using the output from a BufferedReader
        Parameters:
        bodyReader - a BufferedReader containing the HTTP response body. If both a String body (via setBody) and a BufferedReader body (via this method) are set the BufferedReader will overwrite the String body.

      • handleRequest

        public void handleRequest(HttpRequest request)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the request to a given request. The request is used to determine any custom encoding that needs to be performed, such as GZip. Any output will be sent to the OutputStream given in the constructor
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpRequest corresponding to a given respnose. Can be null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an IOException when the outputStream is invalid.
        See Also:
        HttpRequest

      • handleException

        public void handleException(HttpException exception)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an error to the client. The HttpException has additional parameters used for determining error code and message. For general exceptions the InternalServerException class can be used.
        Parameters:
        exception - the HttpException that maps to a given error on the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the outputStream is invalid
        See Also:
        HttpException, InternalServerException

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(Header header)
        Sets a header for the response. Any previously set headers with the same name will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        header - the HTTP header to be sent in the response

      • wasSent

        public boolean wasSent()
        Used to determine if the response has been sent to the OutputStream
        Returns:
        true if the response was sent to the OutputStream of false if it has not been sent
